item.title: Michelle add a quote by Logan Pearsall Smith
item.description: "People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading." -- Logan Pearsall Smith

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Allan Bloom
item.description: "The failure to read good books both enfeebles the vision and strengthens our most fatal tendency -- the belief that the here and now is all there is." -- Allan Bloom

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "There is neither happiness nor misery in the world; there is only the comparison of one state with another, nothing more. He who has felt the deepest grief is best able to experience supreme happiness. We must have felt what it is to die, Morrel, that we may appreciate the enjoyments of life. " Live, then, and be happy, beloved children of my heart, and never forget, that until the day God will deign to reveal the future to man, all human wisdom is contained in these two words, 'Wait and Hope." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "It is not a good fancy,' said the llama. 'What profit to kill men?' Very little - as I know; but if evil men were not now and then slain it would not be a good world for weaponless dreamers." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Michelle add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description: "Some books are undeservedly forgotten; none are undeservedly remembered." -- W.H. Auden
